# attributedPlaceholder

**Instance Property**

The styled string that displays when there is no other text in the text field.

## Declaration

```swift
@NSCopying @MainActor var attributedPlaceholder: NSAttributedString? { get set }
```

## Discussion

This property is `nil` by default. If set, the placeholder string is drawn using system-defined color and the remaining style information (except the text color) of the attributed string. Assigning a new value to this property also replaces the value of the [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UITextField/placeholder] property with the same string data, albeit without any formatting information. Assigning a new value to this property does not affect any other style-related properties of the text field.

## Configuring the text attributes

- **text**: The text that the text field displays.
- **attributedText**: The styled text that the text field displays.
- **placeholder**: The string that displays when there is no other text in the text field.
- **defaultTextAttributes**: The default attributes to apply to the text.
- **font**: The font of the text.
- **textColor**: The color of the text.
- **textAlignment**: The technique for aligning the text.
- **typingAttributes**: The attributes to apply to new text that the user enters.
- **UITextField.BorderStyle**: The type of border around the text field.
